text:
Max expressed he would not like us there as it is a distraction to him and causes him stress and anxiety. I plan to respect that.
Message 2150 of 4024
Thanks for the info. Then obviously I won’t go either. It is unfortunate that “your plan” has made you the single conduit between Max and I. This
has meant I have only had two short meal visits - Thanksgiving and the 2nd Xmas day gathering in 161 days. But this is your plan and only your plan.
So under your “self proclaimed, child centered” approach your plan pencils out to less than 24 hours a year. Curious to see  if the mediator or judge
agrees that your omnipotent approach is consistent with best practices in a divorce.
So, I do nothing now?
Sent:03/14/2024 at 12:30 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 03/14/2024 at 12:46 PM)
Subject:Re: Robotics/Breakfast
Message 2151 of 4024
Trying to get an answer to the question below. Thanks
Sent:03/14/2024 at 01:28 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 03/14/2024 at 01:53 PM)
Subject:Re: Robotics/Breakfast
Message 2152 of 4024
Please see below. That was us less than a week ago. We have gone from violent cooperation to your plan.
Reflecting on where we were vs where we are, what’s your appraisal of your new approach? Better now?
IMHO it feels like you feel obligated to vigorously destroy anything we do that works for the kids.
Is that intentional, or just a subconscious mandate?
Sent:03/14/2024 at 01:43 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 03/14/2024 at 01:57 PM)
Subject:Re: Abv. Running List: Friday 3/8
Message 2153 of 4024
It was advised that unification therapy be explored for you and Max.
It was discussed that attempts to force Max into a situation that he resisted, would be detrimental to his mental and emotional health.
Sent:03/14/2024 at 01:57 PM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 03/14/2024 at 02:02 PM)
Subject:Re: Robotics/Breakfast
